data.sampled:
What is an un-dished fact is an interesting game which is played on an uneven terrain. You need to roll a die which represents your number of rolls before you reach on an un-even space. You then need to roll the die onto your spot and get points by rolling on number 6s, but when you roll 1, 2, or 3, you win the spot. The game is won after a player rolls 10 numbers, while the player with the highest number is the winner. 
If you have any points, then you win the game. The winner is usually offered to take on the opponent's place. 
Overall, the aim of the game is to score the highest number of points. Points earned depend on the result of rolls. So, it is crucial to decide which place to put your number to have the best result. 
In terms of solving mathematical equations, a board and the number of moves to an un-even space is used to calculate the un-done number. It also helps players choose the most efficient board and movement strategy. 
In addition, the result of the number's dice roll impacts which turn you take. The board also contains un-even and number dice. All are used to calculate in the points earned during the game. 
Each turn of the game has its strategy, so when you play an understanding of the rules and the strategy is absolutely necessary in order to win. 

The aim of this task is to write a program in Python using a list to store the board, with a set of rules that are used to determine who wins at each turn. The loop would then run until the player has rolled the same number of numbers each turn. In the example of the board, the number of moves each player has left to reach their destination is also part of the strategy. 

As there are two players involved in this particular game, the main task is to
